t: Proverbs 7
My*pn son, keep my words, And*ld treasure my commands within you.
Keep*ld my commands and live, And*ld my law as the apple of your eye.
Bind*ld them on your fingers; Write*ld them on the tablet of your heart.
Say*ld to wisdom, “You are*i my sister,” And*ld call understanding your*i nearest kin,
That*ld they may keep you from the immoral woman, From*ld the seductress who*i flatters with her words.
The Crafty Harlot
For*pn at the window of my house I*ld looked through my lattice,
And*ld saw among the simple, I*ld perceived among the youths, A*ld young man devoid of understanding,
Passing*ld along the street near her corner; And*ld he took the path to her house
In*ld the twilight, in the evening, In*ld the black and dark night.
And*ln there a woman met him, With*ild the attire of a harlot, and a crafty heart.
She*ld was*i loud and rebellious, Her*ld feet would not stay at home.
At*ld times she*i was*i outside, at times in the open square, Lurking*ld at every corner.
So*ld she caught him and kissed him; With*ld an impudent face she said to him:
“I*ild have*i peace offerings with me; Today*ld I have paid my vows.
So*ld I came out to meet you, Diligently*ld to seek your face, And*ld I have found you.
I*ld have spread my bed with tapestry, Colored*ld coverings of Egyptian linen.
I*ld have perfumed my bed With*ld myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Come,*ld let us take our fill of love until morning; Let*ld us delight ourselves with love.
For*ld my husband is*i not at home; He*ld has gone on a long journey;
He*ld has taken a bag of money with him, And*ild will come home on the appointed day.”
With*ln her enticing speech she caused him to yield, With*ld her flattering lips she seduced him.
Immediately*ld he went after her, as an ox goes to the slaughter, Or*ld as a fool to the correction of the stocks,
Till*ld an arrow struck his liver. As*ld a bird hastens to the snare, He*ld did not know it would*i cost*i his life.
Now*ln therefore, listen to me, my*i children; Pay*ld attention to the words of my mouth:
Do*ld not let your heart turn aside to her ways, Do*ld not stray into her paths;
For*ld she has cast down many wounded, And*ld all who were slain by her were strong men.*i
Her*ld house is*i the way to hell, Descending*ld to the chambers of death.
